Detailed Description

template<class Product, class Output = Product *, class Arg = void>
class TREX::utils::XmlFactory< Product, Output, Arg >

Xml based factory.

Template Parameters:
Product base type of the produced objects
Output returned type by the production
Arg type of the extra argument to give with the XML node

This class uses the Factory template class to make a XML based factory. This XML factory generate objects deriving from Product in the pointer-like object Output and allows to give extra information through the optional type Arg

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>
See also:
Factory
internals::XmlArgHelper

[out] ids The list of available producers

Definition at line 297 of file XmlFactory.hh.

template<class Product , class Output = Product *, class Arg = void>
bool TREX::utils::XmlFactory< Product, Output, Arg >::iter_produce ( iter_type  it,
Output &  ret 
)

iterative creation

Parameters:
[in,out] it an iterator structure
[out] ret variable to store product

While mebedded in a loop, this method allows to iterate through an XML structure and call one of the producers available in this factory any time a valid XML tag is met.

It advances it until the XML tage it is pointing to corresponds to an existing identifier of the factory and produces the corresponfing product which will be stored into ret. After this operation it is pointing to the next XML structure.

Exceptions:
XmlError An error occured while trying to produce the new output. The exception refers to the XML element which was passed to the production method
Return values:
true A new product is in ret and it has advanced
false No production made. is not valid anymore
See also:
produce(argument_type)
class ext_iterator
template<class Product , class Output = Product *, class Arg = void>
static rapidxml::xml_node& TREX::utils::XmlFactory< Product, Output, Arg >::node ( argument_type  arg  )  [inline, static]

XML node extraction.

Parameters:
[in] arg A factory argument

This methods extract the XML content mbedded in arg.

Depending on Arg this access can change and is given by arg_traits. This mthods gives implementers an easy way to access it directly.

Returns:
The XML node embedded in arg
See also:
internals::XmlArgHelper

Definition at line 217 of file XmlFactory.hh.

Referenced by TREX::transaction::TeleoReactor::TeleoReactor().

template<class Product , class Output = Product *, class Arg = void>
Output TREX::utils::XmlFactory< Product, Output, Arg >::operator() ( argument_type  arg  )  [inline]

production method

Parameters:
[in] arg An argument embedding the XML node and potentially extra information of type Arg

This method is called to produce a new object from an xml node. The type of the producer (or ID) is identified through the name of the XML tag

Exceptions:
XmlError an error occurred while trying to extract information from the XML structure
Note:
This method captures all exceptions and convert them to an XmlError. This was done for the following reasons :
  • One single kind of exception is easier to handle
  • as any exception is transformed into an XmlError, the programmer of the called constructor can produce whichever exception he wants while being sure that, when called by the Factory this exception will be transformed into an XmlError
  • provided A cascading set of XmlError the output message will give a rough idea on the tag hierarchy that produced the error.
Returns:
The resulting product

Output TREX::utils::XmlFactory< Product, Output, Arg >::produce ( argument_type  arg  )
